title: Kitchen Timer is the Easiest, Clearest and Most Reliable Timer
comment: Samsung Galaxy S2  i've tried out different timers and alarms, but i came back to this one because of its UI. It's nice and clear, quite easy to understand and to use. the design is straightforward rather than fussy, like some of the others are.  .  i see in a recent review that the user says that the ring was way too loud, but it was not, in the past, and i think that possibly that user needs to look further into his settings. 'dunno for sure, it could be the app itself.  i performed my test today, 9/16/2013 upon another install after not having this wonderful tool available as i was trying out other timers. what i need to say about the volume is that now it is too soft--for me, that is..  is there a way to make it adjust to the user's hearing? i go into many different rooms as i cook, so for me, the ringer needs to blare out at me. i almost burned something i was cooking today, since i tend not to keep my phone with me in my home (i have an office in my house), but rather, on my desk. i was away from it when the ringer went off. whew! i was so lucky to be walking near my desk!  i suggest that you test some of the wake-up alarm apps, to see how to adjust the volume of the alarm.

title: would be perfect with louder ringtones ...
comment: I would happily have given this app a five, but none of the preloaded ringtone volumes are loud enough to hear clearly in most circumstances. I like the app so I'm thinking of subbing one of my own ringtones for one of theirs by giving it the same name.  But it seems pretty silly that the sound should be this faint. If you're using it for a kitchen timer, you probably set your phone down and are some distance away. If you're outdoors and you're wearing a coat over your jeans and your phone's in the pocket, you'll miss it if you don't listen for it really closely which defeats the purpose. Forget about hearing it if it's inside a purse.  Should work if your phone's on a belt-clip, though.

If there is a way to do this that I'm unaware of, I would DEFINITELY use this app 100% of the time.
